00046 //
00047 // One point in a curve
00048 //
00049 class EQPoint
00050 {
00051 public:
00052    EQPoint( const double f, const double d ) { Freq = f; dB = d; }
00053    double Freq;
00054    double dB;
00055 };
00056 WX_DECLARE_OBJARRAY( EQPoint, EQPointArray);
00057 
00058 //
00059 // One curve in a list
00060 //
00061 // LLL:  This "really" isn't needed as the EQPointArray could be
00062 //       attached as wxClientData to the wxChoice entries.  I
00063 //       didn't realize this until after the fact and am too
00064 //       lazy to change it.  (But, hollar if you want me to.)
00065 //
00066 class EQCurve
00067 {
00068 public:
00069    EQCurve( const wxString & name ) { Name = name; }
00070    EQCurve( const wxChar * name ) { Name = name; }
00071    wxString Name;
00072    EQPointArray points;
00073 };
00074 WX_DECLARE_OBJARRAY( EQCurve, EQCurveArray );
00075 
00076 class EffectEqualization: public Effect {
00077 
00078 public:
00079 
00080    EffectEqualization();
00081    virtual ~EffectEqualization();
00082 
00083    virtual wxString GetEffectName() {
00084       return wxString(_("Equalization..."));
00085    }
00086 
00087    virtual std::set<wxString> GetEffectCategories() {
00088       std::set<wxString> result;
00089       result.insert(wxT("http://lv2plug.in/ns/lv2core#EQPlugin"));
00090       return result;
00091    }
00092 
00093    virtual wxString GetEffectIdentifier() {
00094       return wxString(wxT("Equalization"));
00095    }
00096 
00097    virtual wxString GetEffectAction() {
00098       return wxString(_("Performing Equalization"));
00099    }
00100 
00101    virtual bool Init();
00102    virtual void End();
00103    virtual bool PromptUser();
00104    virtual bool DontPromptUser();
00105    virtual bool TransferParameters( Shuttle & shuttle );
00106 
00107    virtual bool Process();
00108 
00109    // Number of samples in an FFT window
00110    enum {windowSize=16384};   //MJS - work out the optimum for this at run time?  Have a dialog box for it?
00111 
00112    // Low frequency of the FFT.  20Hz is the
00113    // low range of human hearing
00114    enum {loFreqI=20};
00115 
00116 private:
00117    bool ProcessOne(int count, WaveTrack * t,
00118                    sampleCount start, sampleCount len);
00119 
00120    void Filter(sampleCount len,
00121                float *buffer);
00122 
00123    float *mFilterFuncR;
00124    float *mFilterFuncI;
00125    int mM;
00126    wxString mCurveName;
00127    bool mLin;
00128    double mdBMax;
00129    double mdBMin;
00130    bool mDrawMode;
00131    int mInterp;
00132    bool mPrompting;
00133 
00134 public:
00135    enum curveType {
00136      amradio, acoustic,
00137      nab, lp, aes, deccaffrrmicro, deccaffrr78, riaa,
00138      col78, deccaffrrlp, emi78, rcavictor1938, rcavictor1947,
00139      nCurveTypes
00140    };
00141 
00142    enum {nCurvePoints=28};
00143    static const float curvex[];
00144    static const float curvey[][nCurvePoints];
00145    static const wxChar * curveNames[];
00146 
00147 friend class EqualizationDialog;
00148 friend class EqualizationPanel;
00149 };

00363    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00364    // All objects must support this property.
00365    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00366 
00367    // Gets the number of children.
00368    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00369 
00370    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00371    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00372    // string if there is no action.
00373    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00374    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00375    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00376    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00377 
00378    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00379    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00380 
00381    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00382    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00383    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00384    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00385    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00386 
00387    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00388    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00389 
00390    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00391    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00392    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00393 
00394    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00395    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00396    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00397 
00398    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00399    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00400 
00401    // Returns a role constant.
00402    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00403 
00404    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00405    // of this object.
00406    // Acceptable values:
00407    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00408    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00409    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00410    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00411    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00412    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00413

00416

00418    // or child.
